newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: Stad Rotterdam put DFL 40 mln with Kempen.
newsitem.headline: Stad Rotterdam put DFL 40 mln with Kempen.

text.p: Dutch insurer Stad Rotterdam NV said on Wednesday it had placed around 40 million guilders of premium income with merchant bank Kempen & Co NV in 1996.
Last May Stad Rotterdam said it would switch from Robeco to Kempen to place newly invested premium, after Robeco said it was planning to start selling life insurance.
Stad Rotterdam chairman Carlo de Swart said on Wednesday it had placed 40 million guilders with the seven funds it had opened up in co-operation with Kempen.
De Swart said Robeco was still handling premiums of around 1.1 billion guilders on behalf of Stad Rotterdam.
This premium was placed with Robeco before May 1996.
"Our policy-holders are free to switch to Kempen though," De Swart said in an interview.
Stad Rotterdam and Robeco fell out after the latter decided to move into life insurance, becoming a direct competitor to Stad Rotterdam.
De Swart said that despite the spat, relations between the two were amicable.
"We send each other Christmas cards," he said.
